Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a buff-coloured pottery jar, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and faint traces of the remains of two lines of black-painted hieratic text mentioning the title ship's captain, as in the oil and incense import inscriptions.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amarna, el-, TA:26/841 The North Suburb, The North Western Quarter, House T.36.10.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393479) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393479)
